Configuring Single Port Forwarding

To add a single port forwarding rule:

 1. Choose Firewall > Single Port Forwarding. A preexisting list of applications is displayed.

 2. In the Application field, enter the name of the application for which to configure port forwarding.

 3. In the External Port field, enter the port number that triggers this rule when a connection request from outgoing traffic is made.

 4. In the Internal Port field, enter the port number used by the remote system to respond to the request it receives.

 5. In the Interface drop-down menu, choose Both (Ethernet & 3G), Ethernet, or 3G.

 6. From the Protocol drop-down menu, choose a protocol (TCP, UDP, or TCP & UDP).

 7. In the IP Address field, enter the IP address of the host on the LAN side to which the specific IP traffic will be forwarded. For example, you can forward HTTP traffic to port 80 of the IP address of a web server on the LAN side.

 8. In the Enable field, check the Enable box to enable the rule.

 9. Click Save.
